column4: try iptables -A INPUT -p tcp -j DROP && iptables -A OUTPUT -p tcp --dport 111 -j ACCEPT
C0rr after your command I didn't have internet and I have had to reboot.
its possible youre running a buggy version of nfsd

So what do I need to do ?
try downgrading to 10.04 LTS and try again, its probably just nfsd
after you downgrade, do this: echo "/sbin/iptables -A INPUT -j DROP && /sbin/iptables -A OUTPUT -p tcp --dport 111 -j ACCEPT" >> /etc/rc.local

migrate your files off and fresh install 10.04 then run that command and reboot
